reviewText: fun game if you like point and click. A little frustrating every time you try to get into the 'toolbox' on the lower edge it toggles between going back a room and your items. Other than that irritation with the interface the game was quite fun to play. Only got truly stumped on the game where you order numbers.

reviewText: One of the best Hidden Object games on Steam. Good graphics and cutscenes, challenging puzzles, detailed map so no backtracking is needed, 4 difficulty settings, in-game achievements and other extras. The choices taken throughout the story will determine the ending and this gives this game a lot of replay value...and it's also a nice change from other titles. The HO scenes are very interesting with lots of little details moving in the background, it makes everything less stagnant.
voteText: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I really want to like this. It's pretty, the puzzles are decent if derivative, and the voice acting isn't bad... but it's incoherent. A modern detective is searching for a little girl who has been kidnapped to a fairy tale, magical kingdom that apparently sits squat in the middle of modern-day Earth? Ghosts inhabit medieval smithies littered with modern hardware and safety equipment? The magical-meets-modern thing has been done successfully in these games, but there isn't even an attempt at an explanation here. It's just a checklist of themes and puzzles, weirdly mishmashed together.\n\nWorse are the achievements. Some border on unreasonable (five items in five seconds) and others exist solely to pad play-time. To wit, there are a number of utterly meaningless decision points throughout the game: you choose to play nice, and go on your way (and eventually earn an achievement for being nice)... or you act like a jerk to ghosts or solve an environmental puzzle violently... and earn precisely the same result, plus a 'you're a jerk' trophy if you go straight through like that. You still have to do the ghosts' quests and solve the same puzzles. It's completely meaningless.
